summary: Internal email chain among SDNY prosecutors discussing travel expenses for a victim/witness related to the Epstein case. The emails inquire about whether the SDNY paid for flights and hotels for the individual for hearings in August 2019 and September 2021, referencing Judge Berman and case preparation.

persons.name: Judge Berman
persons.context: Mentioned as having a heading in the Epstein case; referenced in the context of travel being paid for by SDNY in August 2019.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney Southern District of New York
persons.context: Author of an email inquiring about SDNY payment for travel expenses (flights, hotel) for a victim/witness for hearings in August 2019 and September 2021.

events.title: August 2019 Hearing
events.description: A hearing in the Epstein case where travel expenses (flights, hotel) for a victim/witness were potentially paid for by the SDNY.
personsInvolved: Assistant United States Attorney Southern District of New York

events.title: September 2021 Travel
events.description: Travel by a victim/witness where the SDNY office paid for flights and possibly a hotel.
personsInvolved: Assistant United States Attorney Southern District of New York

keyFacts: The document is an internal SDNY email chain from October 2021 discussing victim/witness travel expenses.
It references Judge Berman in the context of the Epstein case and travel paid for by SDNY in August 2019.
Prosecutors are inquiring about whether SDNY paid for flights and hotels for a victim/witness for hearings in August 2019 and September 2021.
One SDNY employee mentions having 'nothing under the name in 2019' but found airfare charged to the GTA (Government Travel Account) in 2019.
The correspondence indicates case preparation and disclosure processes were underway in October 2021.
